processed.result: There are $n$ boys and $m$ girls attending a club. They need to choose a group of $t$ people ($5 \le t \le n+m$) to act in a play.  The group must have at least 4 boys and at least 1 girl.  How many different groups can they choose?

You have a group of people, some are boys and some are girls. You need to choose a smaller group of a specific size.  The smaller group must have at least 4 boys and at least 1 girl. How many different groups can you make?
